Drake’s legal team, Willkie Farr & Gallagher LLP, said in a statement Jan. 15 that Drake filed the lawsuit “to hold UMG accountable for knowingly promoting false and defamatory allegations against him.”

“Beginning on May 4, 2024 and every day since, UMG has used its massive resources as the world’s most powerful music company to elevate a dangerous and inflammatory message that was designed to assassinate Drake’s character, and led to actual violence at Drake’s doorstep,” the statement reads.

The suit cites examples of the alleged violence that resulted, including an incident on May 7 when an “armed group of assailants” drove to Drake’s Toronto home where at least one gunman opened fire, wounding the rapper’s security guard.

Another alleged incident occurred on May 8 when a different intruder got onto Drake’s Toronto property after using his hands to dig a hole underneath the security fence. The following day, the suit says another break-in attempt happened.
Drake’s legal team made clear that the rapper was suing UMG and not Lamar himself.

“UMG wants the public to believe that this is a fight between rappers, but this lawsuit is not brought against Kendrick Lamar. This lawsuit reveals the human and business consequences to UMG’s elevation of profits over the safety and well-being of its artists, and shines a light on the manipulation of artists and the public for corporate gain,” the team’s statement concluded.
Read on to learn more about Drake’s federal lawsuit against his own record label.
Why is Drake suing his record label, Universal Music Group?

Drake filed a federal lawsuit against his record label, UMG, on Jan. 15 alleging that the company helped to spread a “false and malicious” narrative about him by promoting and releasing his rap rival Kendrick Lamar’s diss track “Not Like Us.”
“Not Like Us,” the lawsuit states, “falsely accuses Drake of being a pedophile and calls for violent retribution against him.”

Drake’s lawsuit notes that the cover image for “Not Like Us” features an aerial photo of Drake’s home in Toronto that’s covered with red markers like those that are used “to identify child sex offenders and their residences on public registries,” the lawsuit alleges.
The suit also details several violent break-in attempts at Drake’s Toronto home that he and his legal team believe were “proximately caused by” the lyrics of “Not Like Us.”

“The lyrics repeatedly accuse Drake of engaging in criminal acts, including by calling him a ‘certified pedophile[]’ and a ‘predator’ who needs to be ‘placed on neighborhood watch,’” the lawsuit states.

Drake and his team allege that UMG chose “corporate greed over the safety and well-being of its artists,” by releasing the single even though they “knew that the salacious allegations against Drake were false.”

Drake’s legal team previously filed a petition in November, which was later withdrawn on Jan. 14, accusing UMG of using payola and bots to boost the popularity of “Not Like Us” on Spotify. The new lawsuit, however, does include similar messaging and repeats some of the same claims.
UMG responded to Drake’s legal petition in November, saying they use “ethical practices” for their campaigns.

“We employ the highest ethical practices in our marketing and promotional campaigns. No amount of contrived and absurd legal arguments in this pre-action submission can mask the fact that fans choose the music they want to hear,” the statement read.

Spotify declined to comment to NBC News at the time of Drake’s complaint. The music streaming service, however, does note on their website that artificial streaming is a major issue and they strictly prohibit “using any third party service that promises streams or playlist placement in exchange for money.”
How has UMG responded to Drake's lawsuit?
UMG responded to Drake’s lawsuit in a statement on Jan. 15., saying the claims were “untrue” and the idea that the label would want to “harm” any of its artists is “illogical.”

“We have invested massively in his music and our employees around the world have worked tirelessly for many years to help him achieve historic commercial and personal financial success,” the label said.

“Throughout his career, Drake has intentionally and successfully used UMG to distribute his music and poetry to engage in conventionally outrageous back-and-forth ‘rap battles’ to express his feelings about other artists. He now seeks to weaponize the legal process to silence an artist’s creative expression and to seek damages from UMG for distributing that artist’s music.”
Spotify declined to comment to TODAY.com as of Jan. 17.
What exactly does Kendrick Lamar say about Drake in ‘Not Like Us’?
Among Lamar’s derogatory punchlines about Drake in “Not Like Us,” one of the verses he raps references Drake and pedophilia.

“Say, Drake, I hear you like ‘em young/ You better not ever go to cell block one,” and later adds, “Certified Lover Boy? Certified pedophiles,” a reference to Drake’s 2021 album, “Certified Lover Boy,” he raps in the song.
The song also mentions a “predator” whose name “gotta be registered and placed on neighborhood watch.”
How did the beef between Drake and Kendrick Lamar start?

Drake and Lamar weren’t always rivals. Early on in his career, Lamar appeared as a guest artist on Drake’s song “Buried Alive Interlude” from his second studio album, “Take Care,” released in November 2011, and he also appeared as a guest on his “Club Paradise Tour” the following year.

However, things changed after Lamar took shots at Drake and other rappers during his guest verses on Big Sean’s song “Control” in August 2013. He appeared to ridicule Drake again in his lyrics during a performance at the BET Hip-Hop Awards in October 2013.
Between 2014 and 2020 the two artists released several diss tracks about each other but the vitriol between the rappers seemed to die down shortly after that.

Then, in October 2023, Drake collaborated with fellow rapper J.Cole on a track called “First Person Shooter.” J.Cole bragged on the track that he, Drake and Lamar were “Big 3” artists in rap, while Drake’s verses compared his stardom to that of Michael Jackson’s.
Lamar responded to “First Person Shooter” in March 2024 in blistering guest verses on Metro Boomin and Future’s collaborative track “Like That,” which rose to the top of the Billboard Hot 100 chart.
Lamar blasted the idea of a “Big 3,” insisting there was only a “Big Me.” He also ridiculed Drake for comparing himself to Michael Jackson while likening himself to Prince.

Lamar’s guest verses prompted Drake to quickly release a new diss track about Lamar called “Push Ups,” in which he called Lamar a “pipsqueak.” Less than two weeks later, Lamar took another swipe at Drake in a song called “Euphoria.”
The diss tracks continued at a breakneck pace until it eventually died down in the summer of 2024.
How successful has ‘Not Like Us’ been?
Both Drake and Lamar have benefited from their renewed beef over the past year. Both artists scored multiple hit songs and received several competing nominations at the 2024 BET Awards.
“Not Like Us,” has been streamed more than a billion times on Spotify, and won five Grammys Awards, including record and song of the year.
Lamar was also tapped to headline the Super Bowl halftime show in New Orleans on Feb. 9.

title: The complete history of Kendrick Lamar and Drake's rap beef
summary: Drake and Kendrick Lamar's longstanding feud, starting with "Control" and continuing with diss tracks released in April and May 2024.
story: In the longstanding rap feud between Kendrick Lamar and Drake, which has produced numerous diss tracks, including the viral and Grammy-winning song, "Not Like Us," Drake has decided to take the legal route in his latest response to the ongoing drama.

The Toronto rapper, whose birth name is Aubrey Drake Graham, filed an 81-page federal lawsuit Jan. 15, alleging his record label, Universal Music Group, helped to spread a “false and malicious” narrative about him when it promoted and released Lamar's diss track “Not Like Us.”
Drake and Kendrick are both signed UMG, Drake to the UMG division Republic Records while Lamar is signed to UMG’s Interscope division.

Drake's lawsuit comes after Lamar was announced as the music headliner for the 2025 Super Bowl halftime show in September 2024 and Lamar was nominated for seven 2025 Grammys, including “Not Like Us” receiving a nod for record and song of the year.

As you may recall, Lamar released “Not Like Us” back in May 2024 after his longtime feud with Drake was reignited earlier that year, prompting both rappers to release a slew of diss tracks about each other.
But before all the drama, hip-hop fans may remember a time when the two rappers were more like buddies than rivals, even collaborating and touring together.
From friends to foes: A complete history of Kendrick Lamar and Drake's beef
So what caused the rift between Drake and his one-time pal Lamar? Read on for a complete history of rap’s most enduring feuds.
2011: Lamar appears as a guest on Drake's album 'Take Care'
Early in his career, Lamar appeared as a guest artist on the song “Buried Alive Interlude” on Drake's second studio album, "Take Care," released in November 2011.
Feb. 2012: Drake invites Lamar to be his opening act on his 'Club Paradise Tour'
Drake followed that up by inviting Lamar and A$AP Rocky to be the opening acts on his "Club Paradise Tour," which launched in February 2012.
Oct. 2012: The two rappers collaborate on the track 'Poetic Justice' from Lamar's album 'Good Kid, M.A.A.D City'
Drake and Lamar collaborated on the song "Poetic Justice" featured on Lamar's studio album "Good Kid, M.A.A.D City," released in October 2012.
The same month, Drake and Lamar appeared as guests on A$AP Rocky’s song “F----- Problems."
Aug. 2013: Lamar takes a shot at Drake and other rappers on Big Sean’s 'Control'
Tensions began when Lamar called out Drake and 11 other rappers by name when he appeared as a guest on Big Sean's song "Control" in August 2013.

“I got love for you all but I’m trying to murder you n----/ Trying to make sure your core fans never heard of you n----/ They don’t want to hear not one more noun or verb from you n---- ," he rapped on the track.
Full of swagger over his rising success, Lamar also declared himself both “King of New York” and “King of the Coast” on the track.
Aug. 2013: Drake shrugs off Lamar's verse in an interview
Two weeks after "Control" is released, Drake reveals in a cover story for Billboard that Lamar's nasty name-check didn't upset him.
"It just sounded like an ambitious thought to me. That’s all it was," Drake told the publication. "I know good and well that (Lamar)’s not murdering me, at all, in any platform."
Sept. 2013: Drake says it's 'all love' between him and Lamar
Drake reportedly doubled down on the soundness of his friendship with Lamar during a live #CRWN interview with Elliott Wilson of RapRadar on Sept. 22, 2013, in New York, according to Vibe.
After conceding that Lamar's biting guest verse on "Control" was a "moment to talk about," Drake said the two rappers saw each other at the MTV VMAs soon after the song was released.
“I saw him five days later at the VMAs and it was all love,” Drake recalled.
Oct. 2013: Lamar disses Drake again in his BET Hip-Hop Awards cypher
Lamar appeared to be taking aim at Drake again in his BET Hip-Hop Awards cypher in October 2013.
Lamar's performance came within days of Drake releasing his September 2013 album “Nothing Was the Same."

“Nothing’s been the same since they dropped ‘Control’/ And tucked a sensitive rapper back in his pajama clothes/ Ha ha joke’s on you, high-five… I’m bulletproof/ Your shots never penetrate/ Pin the tail on the donkey, boy you been a fake," he rapped.
December 2013: Drake tells an interviewer he feels like he's being 'baited' by Lamar
Speaking to Vibe in December 2013, Drake revealed that he felt as though he was being "baited" by Lamar on the "Control" verse.

“Where it became an issue is that I was rolling out an album while that verse was still bubbling, so my album rollout became about this thing. What am I supposed to say? Nah, we’ll be buddy-buddy?" asked the rapper.
"Mind you, I never once said he’s a bad guy (or) I don’t like him. I think he’s a f----- genius in his own right, but I also stood my ground as I should.

"And with that came another step, which then I have to realize I’m being baited and I’m not gonna fall," he said. "(Michael) Jordan doesn’t have to play pickup to prove that he could play ball, no offense. But I’m not gonna give you the chance to shake me necessarily, ’cause I feel great. There’s no real issue."
2014 - 2020: The two rappers take shots at each other on several more diss tracks
The beef between the two rappers continued for several more years as they released or appeared as guest artists on several more diss tracks taking shots at each other.
By 2020, the bad feelings appeared to have faded away. But not for long.
Oct. 2023: J. Cole collaborates with Drake on 'First Person Shooter'

In October 2023, Drake collaborated with fellow rapper J.Cole on a track called "First Person Shooter." J. Cole brags about his rapping prowess on the track, referring to himself, Drake and Lamar as the "Big Three," singling himself out as Muhammad Ali, or in other words, the greatest of all.
For his part, Drake boasted about his own popularity as a music star, comparing himself to Michael Jackson.
March 2024: Lamar blasts Drake and J.Cole on 'Like That'

In March 2024, Lamar responded to "First Person Shooter" by blasting Drake and J.Cole in guest verses on Metro Boomin and Future's collaborative track “Like That," which rose to the top of the Billboard Hot 100 chart.
Lamar laughed off the idea of a "Big 3," insisting there was only a "Big Me," and then ridiculed Drake for likening himself to Michael Jackson by insisting he would be Prince in the scenario.
"Prince outlived Mike Jack," he rapped.
April 19, 2024: Drake calls Lamar a 'pipsqueak' on 'Push Ups'

A fired-up Drake blasted back at Lamar the following month with the diss track "Push Ups," on which he addressed the diminutive rapper as “pipsqueak" and asks him, "How the f--- you big steppin’ with a size-seven men’s on?"
Drake also put down his old rival's music collaborations with pop artists. "Maroon 5 need a verse, you better make it witty/ Then we need a verse for the Swifties," he raps.
"Push Ups" notably sampled beats from The Notorious B.I.G.’s 1997 track “What’s Beef?”
April 30, 2024: Lamar releases 'Euphoria'

On April 30, Lamar released a furious six-minute track called "Euphoria," continuing his rift with Drake, who just happens to have served as an executive producer on the TV series “Euphoria,” according to IMDb.
Lamar, who’s won a Pulitzer Prize for his music, bashes the more commercially successful Drake on the track, rapping, “I make music that electrify ’em, you make music that pacify ’em.”
May 3, 2024: Lamar follows up with '6:16 in LA'

Days later, Lamar released “6:16 in LA” on his Instagram page. The song's title pokes fun at Drake’s time-and-location-themed songs, such as “6PM in New York," "9AM in Dallas,” and “4PM in Calabasas."
Lamar name-checks OVO, the independent music label owned by Drake, on the song.

"Have you ever thought that OVO was working for me?/ Fake bully, I hate bullies/ You must be a terrible person/ Everyone inside your team is whispering that you deserve it," he raps as he continues to imply that key insiders at OVO are Team Lamar.
This song notably samples Al Green's “What a Wonderful Thing Love Is," which the soul singer seemingly acknowledged by tweeting out his original track on the same day of Lamar's track.
May 4, 2024: Drake responds with third diss track, 'Family Matters'

Drake responded to Lamar’s “6:16 in LA” diss track with a record called “Family Matters.” In his nearly eight-minute diss, which was accompanied by a music video that showed New Ho King Chinese restaurant Lamar referenced on “Euphoria,” Drake takes shots at Lamar’s relationship with his fiancée, Whitney Alford, alleging abuse and infidelity.

“You the Black messiah wifing up a mixed queen/ And hit vanilla cream to help out with your self-esteem/ On some Bobby s---, I wanna know what Whitney need,” he spits, before later adding, “When you put your hands on your girl, is it self-defense ’cause she’s bigger than you?”
Drake also took verbal shots at other rappers he’s reportedly beefing with, including A$AP Rocky, The Weeknd, Metro Boomin, Future and Rick Ross.
May 4, 2024: Kendrick Lamar responds to Drake with scathing diss, 'Meet the Grahams'
Soon after Drake’s “Family Matters” arrived, Lamar returned with a blistering response called “Meet the Grahams.”
In the 6 1/2-minute track, Lamar seemingly calls out Drake for being a deadbeat dad and alleges he’s hiding another child, a daughter, from the world.
“You lied about your son, you lied about your daughter, huh, you lied about them other kids that’s out there hoping that you come,” he raps.
He also takes shots at Drake’s family, alleged alcohol abuse, a gambling addiction and that the Toronto rapper used Ozempic for weight loss and had cosmetic surgery.
“Get some discipline, don’t cut them corners like your daddy did. F--- what Ozempic did. Don’t pay to play with them Brazilians, get a gym membership,” he raps.
May 4, 2024: Kendrick Lamar follows up  'Meet the Grahams' with 'Not Like Us'
Lamar didn't wait for Drake to respond to his third diss track, "Meet the Grahams," opting to release a fourth targeted diss track at Drake with "Not Like Us.'

The track, which is currently the No. 2 trending video on YouTube, is a 4 1/2-minute verbal attack on the Toronto rapper, taking aim at his alleged predilection for young women and his recent legal drama with Tupac's estate after releasing his “Taylor Made Freestyle” diss track at Lamar, which featured an AI-generated Tupac voice.

On the track, Lamar raps, “Say, Drake, I hear you like ‘em young/ You better not ever go to cell block one,” and later adds, “Certified Lover Boy? Certified pedophiles,” a nod to Drake’s 2021 album, “Certified Lover Boy,” that seemingly accuses the rapper of pedophilia.

Later in the song, which also challenges Drake's street credibility and reputation, Lamar also takes Drake to task about his “Taylor Made Freestyle” diss track, rapping, "You think the Bay gon’ let you disrespect Pac, n----? I think that Oakland show gon’ be your last stop, n----.”
May 5, 2024: Drake drops 'The Heart Part 6'

Drake's newest diss track about Lamar shot to the top of the YouTube trending chart after its release on May 5. In the nearly 5 1/2-minute song, Drake denied Lamar's previous allegations of pedophilia and also alleged he made up information about having a secret 11-year-old daughter for Lamar to use in a song.
Lamar has yet to comment or release a response to "The Heart Part 6," but Drake rapped on the track he was waiting for words from Lamar.

"You know, at least your fans are gettin’ some raps out of you/ I’m happy I could motivate you/ Bring you back to the game," Drake said. "Just let me know when we’re gettin’ to the facts/ Everything in my s--- is facts/ I’m waitin’ on you to return the favor."
May 8, 2024: Seth Rogen reacts to the rappers' feud
Actor and comedian Seth Rogen weighed in on beef between the two rappers when he hosted "Seth Rogen Smokes the Bowl," an event for his Alzheimer’s charity Hilarity For Charity.
While taking the mic, Rogen shared his thoughts about the ongoing feud between Drake and Lamar.
First, he said: “If you’re a rap fan, there’s some crazy sh-t going on right now.”
While updating the audience on what's been going on, Rogen joked that Lamar and Drake have been writing "mean rhymes about each other, which is an objectively funny way to fight with another person."

The comedian then said that Drake started to get "defensive" once Lamar called him a "bad father" and that Lamar dissed saying that the "In My Feelings" rapper should be a "registered sex offender" in one of his songs.

"That changed the tone of the whole conversation pretty dramatically," Rogen said. "Drake was caught off guard and then he started writing raps and his raps were, like, defensive now all of a sudden, which is a funny thing to hear."

"You don't hear defensive rapping that often. Rap is usually pretty aggressive. You don't hear rap that's like, I am a good father. I should not be registered. I would say as soon as you are asserting in a rap song that you should not be a registered sex offender, you've lost the rap battle," he said.
May 13, 2024: Kendrick Lamar's 'Not Like Us' lands at No. 1 on Billboard Hot 100

Billboard reported on May 13 that Lamar's "Not Like Us" debuted at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. This marks the Compton rapper's fourth Hot 100 No. 1. Additionally, his track "Euphoria" went from No. 11 to No. 3 on the same chart.

However, Drake’s diss track "Family Matters" debuted at No. 7 on the same chart. Since this is Drake's 78th song to be included in the top 10 on the Hot 100 chart, it makes him the artist with the most top 10 entries, per the magazine.
May 16, 2024: Kendrick Lamar and Drake receive competing nominations at the 2024 BET Awards
Lamar and Drake will be going head to head at the 2024 BET Awards as the two have been nominated for best male hip-hop artist and best collaboration.
For best collaboration, Drake is nominated for “Rich Baby Daddy” with SZA and Sexyy Red, while Lamar is nominated for his guest verse on the remix of Beyoncé’s “America Has a Problem.”
Drake is also nominated for album of the year for "For All The Dogs (Scary Hours Edition), best male R&B/pop artist, video of the year, among others.
Their nods came after Lamar’s track “Not Like Us” debuted at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. Released on May 4, the song was the Compton rapper’s latest diss track in the ongoing feud.
“Not Like Us” marks Lamar’s fourth Hot 100 No. 1. Additionally, his track “Euphoria” went from No. 11 to No. 3 on the same chart.

However, one of Drake’s diss tracks also saw some success. The Canadian native’s song “Family Matters” debuted at No. 7 on the same chart. This is Drake’s 78th song to be included in the top 10 on the Hot 100 chart, making him the artist with the most top 10 entries, per the magazine.
June 19, 2024: Kendrick Lamar adds a new verse to his Drake diss track at L.A. concert
Lamar threw some fuel on the fire when he debuted a new verse to "Euphoria," his hit diss track of Drake, at his "The Pop Out - Ken and Friends" concert in Los Angeles on Juneteenth.
“Give me Tupac’s ring back and I might give you a little respect,” Lamar rapped.

Lamar was referring to Drake's $1 million purchase of a crown-shaped ring filled with rubies and diamonds that once belonged to legendary rapper Tupac Shakur, who was killed in 1996. The ring, which is the most valuable hip-hop artifact ever sold according to Smithsonian Magazine, features a crown with rubies and diamonds.
The buyer remained a mystery until Drake was seen showing it off in an interview at a New York City strip club, according to Billboard.

In a separate issue, Shakur’s estate threatened to sue Drake in April over his diss track about Lamar called “Taylor Made Freestyle.” The track appeared to use an artificial intelligence-generated version of Shakur’s voice, prompting a cease-and-desist letter from an attorney representing the late rapper’s estate.
The track was then removed from Drake’s X and Instagram accounts.
July 4, 2024: Kendrick Lamar releases his highly anticipated video 'Not Like Us'
Two months after releasing his viral Drake diss track, "Not Like Us," Lamar dropped the highly anticipated music video for the song.

In the nearly six-minute video, which was filmed in Compton and includes a cameo from the record’s producer, DJ Mustard, among other prominent West Coast figures, the visuals feature a rare appearance by Lamar’s fiancée, Whitney Alford, and their two young children: daughter Uzi and son Enoch.
In one part of the video, the family of four is seen dancing around in what appeared to be the family’s home.
Aside from some touching moments, the video maintained its original purpose and intention: to take a direct jab at Drake.

Among multiple Easter eggs, there were several visual references to owls, the bird associated with Drake’s OVO label. This includes a scene where Lamar is seen smashing an owl piñata, while a disclaimer floats across the screen reading, “no OVHoes were harmed during the making of this video.”
July 9, 2024: Argentinian soccer team celebrates win with 'Not Like Us' reference

After sharing on his Instagram story that he was betting on Canada to win over Argentina in the Copa America semifinals, Drake was seemingly sent a special message from the Argentinian soccer team after they beat Canada 2-0.
Securing goals from Julián Álvarez and Lionel Messi, Argentina’s social media account posted a team photo on X with the following message: “Not like us, not with us.”
The message, which appeared to reference Lamar’s chart-topping diss track, also included the Argentinian flag added next to it.
July 10: Siri swaps Drake's 'Certified Lover Boy' for Kendrick Lamar's 'Not Like Us'

In a viral video posted on X July 10, HipHopDX’s Jeremy Hecht shared what appeared to be a glitch concerning Apple’s Siri. He noted that if a fan used iPhone’s Siri app to ask the device to play Drake’s “Certified Lover Boy,” Spotify would instead put on Lamar’s “Not Like Us.”
As Hecht explained, Siri appears to be doing this because the app, which uses lyrics, songs and album titles to identify music, doesn’t always go by a song’s specific title.

For those scratching their heads as to how Siri could possibly mix up the two distinctive tracks, Hecht reminded fans that in Lamar’s “Not Like Us” song he references Drake’s record by rapping, “Certified Lover Boy? Certified pedophile.” This mention is what appears to create the confusion for Siri.

However, it’s worth noting that the mixup doesn’t always happen and that for some users, after Lamar’s song is played instead of Drake’s, Spotify seemingly corrects itself when asked by Siri for the second time.
TODAY.com reached out to Apple and Spotify for comment, but did not hear back at the time of publication.
Sept. 8, 2024: Kendrick Lamar tapped to headline the Super Bowl halftime show
Kendrick Lamar was announced as the headliner for the 2025 Super Bowl halftime show in New Orleans.
“Rap music is still the most impactful genre to date. And I’ll be there to remind the world why. They got the right one,” Lamar said in an NFL-released statement.
Super Bowl 59 will take place on Feb. 9 at Caesars Superdome. Lamar previously performed at the 2022 Super Bowl in Los Angeles with several other hip-hop stars in a West Coast-themed show.
It was later confirmed in January 2025 by the NFL that Lamar's frequent collaborator, SZA, would join him on the stage as a guest star.
Sept. 11, 2024: Kendrick Lamar releases first song since 'Not Like Us'

Kendrick Lamar posted an untitled song to his Instagram Reels on the evening of Sept. 11. His uncaptioned post, which showed a photo of black Air Force 1 sneakers, was uploaded at the start of the MTV Video Music Awards on Wednesday night.

Though he hasn't offered any commentary on his new track, which has since sparked conversation online about an upcoming rumored album, the song comes after his heated monthslong feud between him and rapper Drake.
It also comes after Lamar's previous track, “Not Like Us,” hit No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 and was one of the top songs of the summer, according to the Billboard’s summer songs chart.

Fans will soon get to see and hear more of Lamar at this year's Super Bowl as he's set to perform to at the 2025 Apple Music Super Bowl LIX Halftime show on February 9, 2025, at the Caesars Superdome in New Orleans.
Oct. 15, 2024: Kendrick Lamar wins over Drake at the BET Hip Hop Awards
Kendrick Lamar dominated the 2024 BET Hip Hop Awards.

The West Coast rapper, who was nominated for 11 awards, took home eight, including “Lyricist of the Year,” “Hip-Hop Artist of the Year,” “Song of the Year,” and “Video Director of the Year” with Dave Free for their hit “Not Like Us.”
He beat out Drake, who was nominated for eight awards, in multiple categories including, “Lyricist of the Year,” “Hip-Hop Artist of the Year,” and “Best Hip-Hop Video.”
Nov. 18, 2024: Kendrick Lamar receives seven Grammy Award nominations
Kendrick Lamar received seven Grammy Award nominations, including five nods for "Not Like Us," which is up for record and song of the year.
Meanwhile, Drake, who criticized the Recording Academy in recent years and said he would not be submitting his albums for Grammys, didn’t receive any nominations.
Nov. 22, 2024: Kendrick Lamar releases sixth studio album 'GNX'

In a surprise release on Nov. 22, 2024, Kendrick Lamar released his six studio album, "GNX." The album features guest appearances from SZA, Dody6, Lefty Gunplay, Wallie the Sensei, Siete7x, Roddy Ricch, AzChike, Hitta J3, YoungThreat, and Peysoh.
The 12-track album is the rapper's first full-length release since 2022’s "Mr. Morale & The Big Steppers."
Jan. 15, 2025: Drake sues UMG over 'Not Like Us'

Drake filed an 81-page federal lawsuit in January, suing his record label, Universal Music Group, for defamation and harassment. The Toronto rapper alleged that the company helped to spread a “false and malicious” narrative about him when they promoted and released Lamar's “Not Like Us.”

UMG “approved, published, and launched a campaign to create a viral hit out of a rap track that falsely accuses Drake of being a pedophile and calls for violent retribution against him,” the lawsuit reads.
Drake is seeking nominal, punitive and compensatory damages, and asking a judge to order UMG to state that the statements made in “Not Like Us” are false.
In the lawsuit, Drake’s legal team made it clear that the rapper was suing UMG and not Lamar himself.
Drake is signed to the UMG division Republic Records while Lamar is signed to UMG’s Interscope division.
Feb. 2, 2025: Kendrick sweeps Grammys with 'Not Like Us'
Kendrick Lamar brought home five Grammys on Feb. 2 for "Not Like Us."
During the ceremony, Lamar won the record and song Grammy for "Not Like Us."
Earlier in the evening, during the Grammys Premiere Ceremony, the rapper's song picked up awards for best rap song, best rap performance and best music video.

title: Kendrick Lamar's 2025 Super Bowl halftime show: Start time, special guests and songs
summary: Super Bowl 59 has finally arrived, with all eyes on the Philadelphia Eagles and the Kansas City Chiefs.
story: Super Bowl 59 has finally arrived, with all eyes on the matchup between the Philadelphia Eagles and the Kansas City Chiefs.
But another major player will be featured on football's biggest stage Sunday night in New Orleans, Louisiana: Kendrick Lamar.
The 22-time Grammy winner is headlining the Super Bowl's Apple Music Halftime Show on Feb. 9 at Caesars Superdome, with fans expecting to hear their favorite hits and see special guests appearances.
But what time is the halftime show expected to start? Here's what to know about this year's Super Bowl halftime show.
Who’s performing at the Super Bowl halftime show?
Kendrick Lamar will be headlining the Super Bowl halftime show, marking the first time a solo hip-hop artist is performing at the big game.

Though Sunday night will be Lamar's first time as the headlining act, he has previously performed during the 2022 Super Bowl halftime show alongside icons like Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg and Mary J. Blige, among others.
Who will Kendrick Lamar bring out during his halftime show?
After announcing in September that he would be taking the stage at halftime, Lamar revealed SZA as his special guest in a Jan. 23 Instagram post.

The two are fresh off announcing their joint Grand National Tour, which kicks off in April. Lamar and SZA have collaborated on a number of songs over the years, including “All The Stars,” “luther” and “30 for 30.”
Though Lamar hasn't officially announced any additional guests set to join him on stage, fans have some predictions based on the location of the game, the rapper's discography and past performances.

With Taylor Swift expected to be at the game, cheering on boyfriend and Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce, the singer could reunite with Lamar for their 2015 rendition of "Bad Blood." Swift was also a visible supporter of Lamar at the 2025 Grammys, when he beat her out for record of the year.

While it's likely the internet might break if he brings Swift out during his halftime performance, there's one other star that could similarly shatter the minds of music fans everywhere if Lamar brings her out: Beyoncé. If you recall, the two collaborated on the track “Freedom” and “AMERICA HAS A PROBLEM” remix. Lamar previously joined Queen Bey on her Renaissance World Tour in September 2023.

Coming off the Grammys buzz, there's a world where Lamar could feature recently minted new artist of the year Grammy winner, Doechii, in his performance. He's previously called the rapper the "hardest out" and has collaborated on a short film with her.
Lamar has been known to bring his younger cousin, rapper Baby Keem, onstage for both full sets and cameos. The two would likely join forces for “Family Ties.”

Lil Wayne would also be an obvious choice for Lamar, given the Super Bowl is taking place in Weezy’s hometown of New Orleans and they could perform 2018 hit “Mona Lisa.” But, since Wayne felt some ways about being overlooked for the 2025 Super Bowl halftime show, his appearance might be a long shot.
When is the Super Bowl halftime show?
Officially, there's not a set start time for the Super Bowl halftime show, but there are clues to know when it will start. Let's break it down.

The game is comprised of four 15-minute quarters. Taking in account the breaks between plays, pausing for calls, time between quarters and commercial breaks, the entire Super Bowl typically lasts about three and half hours.

This means fans can expect the midpoint or halftime to be about 90 minutes into the game. In Sunday's case, with a 6:30 p.m. ET kickoff, halftime will likely be around 8-8:30 p.m. ET. So if you are only tuning in for Kendrick Lamar's halftime show, then be ready to tune in around 8:30 p.m. ET the latest.
How to watch the Super Bowl halftime show
The Super Bowl will be broadcast live on FOX and will be available for streaming on the FOX Sports app, the NFL app, YouTube TV, Hulu + Live TV and FuboTV.
The game will also be available for free with Tubi, which is owned by the Fox Corporation. The Tubi app is available on various streaming devices, smart TVs and mobile phones.
Will Kendrick Lamar perform ‘Not Like Us’ during the Super Bowl halftime show?
“Not Like Us,” Lamar’s diss track heard around the country, was the rapper’s biggest song of 2024, winning him five Grammy Awards.
Leading up to this year's halftime show, fans are wondering if and when Lamar would feature the song, which directly calls out his collaborator-turned-rival, Drake.

After its massive success, the song would be a natural choice to include in Lamar's setlist. However, Drake sued Lamar in January for defamation and harassment over the song. Though Lamar would not be sued for singing the track, the NFL could face legal repercussions.

“Not Like Us” has reached 1 billion streams and took home Grammy wins in all categories for which it was nominated, including, song of the year, record of the year, best rap song, best rap performance, and best music video.
Lamar has been tight-lipped about his upcoming performance, not yet revealing if he will perform “Not Like Us.”

title: Prince Harry shows off his dance moves in rare IG story by Meghan Markle
summary: Meghan Markle shared a clip of Prince Harry dancing on her Instagram story at the 2025 Invictus Games.
story: Meghan Markle gave a glimpse into Prince Harry’s silly side on social media.

Over the weekend, Markle shared a series of Instagram stories to mark the 2025 Invictus Games, which were launched by her husband in 2014. This year, the event is takes place in Vancouver, Canada from Feb. 8 through Feb. 16.

In a short video from Feb. 8, shared on her Instagram story and fittingly set to the Generation X tune “Dancing With Myself,” Harry is seen with back to the camera as he faced a large group posing for a photo.
Before joining in on the photo opp, he showed off his smooth footwork and did a little jig before he went to stand next to his wife for the photo.
Markle shared several more moments from the first day of the Invictus Games, including a sweet video of her interacting with Team USA followed by a short clip posing for a photo with the team.

She also took a moment to capture part of Chris Martin’s performance at the opening ceremony as he improvised a cheery tune about the event accompanied by his guitar. At the end of the clip, she captured her husband’s live reaction as he clapped along.
Other performances at the opening ceremony included Katy Perry, Noah Kahan, Roxane Bruneau, and Nelly Furtado.
Markle officially rejoined Instagram at the beginning of 2025 after a seven-year hiatus from the social media platform.
She previously shut down her lifestyle blog, The Tig, in 2017 after her engagement to Harry. Markle later deleted her personal Instagram account months before their 2018 wedding.
Her return to social media also came with a big announcement — a new Netflix show, “With Love, Meghan.”

The show, which was announced on Jan. 2, will feature a variety of lifestyle and culinary tips. The episodes will also feature special guests, including her husband, as well as actors Mindy Kaling and Abigail Spencer, and esteemed chefs Roy Choi and Alice Waters.
The show was initially set to premiere on Jan. 15, but the release date was pushed back to March 14 due to the Los Angeles wildfires, which have since been contained.

title: Christy Carlson Romano shows gruesome eye injury after being ‘shot in the face’ while shooting clay pigeons
summary: Actor Christy Carlson Romano says she was shot in the face while shooting clay pigeons with her husband, showing off her bloodied eye in a new video.
story: Actor Christy Carlson Romano says she was shot in the face while shooting clay pigeons with her husband, showing off her bloodied eye in a new video.

In a clip posted to Instagram Feb. 8, the former Disney Channel star explained that she and husband Brendan Rooney went shooting in Texas for his birthday, when someone in another party "unsafely fired in the wrong direction and shot me in the face.”
“So I got shot in the eye, it was not fun,” she began the video. I am safe.”
Romano showed what appeared to be a small gash underneath her eye with some bruising, explaining that “it’s still inside” her face. She showed other parts of her face that contained “fragments.”
In the caption, she said the fragment lodged behind her eye is “too risky” to surgically remove at this time, adding that she can currently “see normally.”
“I’m very grateful to first responders as a whole. I mean, they’re just the most amazing, superhero people to take care of us at our most desperate times,” she said.
Continuing to show her eye injury, Romano continued, “This is really bad tonight. Everything’s kind of clearing out, but I got to say I got shot in the face and lived to tell the tale.”
“Be grateful for every day,” she concluded in the video.
Romano thanked Rooney in the caption and said she was struck in five places, one being “less than an inch from hitting me directly in my right eye.”

“With everything that happened, all I can think about is how grateful I am to be alive,” she wrote. “I love my daughters, husband, family, and friends so much. I saw my life flash before my eyes and I’m telling you, hug the people around you every chance you can. Life can change in an instant.”
Rooney commented on his wife’s Instagram post, writing that she is the “bravest, toughest, most stoic and badass woman I have ever met.”

“I am so thankful you are alive. I am so thankful you are the mother to our children,” he continued, referencing their two kids. “I wouldn’t know what to do without you. I love you more than life itself.”
On his own Instagram, Rooney shared Romano’s clip to his story and wrote, “Kiss your loved ones.”

title: Adam Brody’s tribute to wife Leighton Meester in speech has fans swooning: ‘Everyone wants this’
summary: Adam Brody gave a heartfelt tribute to his wife, Leighton Meester, during his acceptance speech at the 2025 Critics’ Choice Awards on Feb. 7.
story: Adam Brody gave a heartfelt tribute to his wife, Leighton Meester, during a recent acceptance speech.
Brody took home the award for best actor in a comedy series for his role as Noah in Netflix’s “Nobody Wants This” at the 2025 Critics’ Choice Awards on Feb. 7.
After he was announced as the winner, he kissed Meester and made his way to the stage to deliver a touching speech.
He initially thanked the cast, including co-star Kristen Bell, series creator Erin Foster, the crew and his team, before he ended with a sweet sentiment about his wife of more than 10 years.

“My darling, darling, darling wife, Leighton. Thank you,” he said. “Thank you for sharing this life with me and this journey with me. Thank you for our family. I love you with all my heart. Thank you so much.”
After Brody won the award, the couple shared a romantic kiss before the actor pulled his wife into a tight embrace.
Fans reacted to the moment between the notoriously private couple in the comment section. Digital creator Erin McGoff wrote, “Everyone wants this,” as a nod to the Netflix hit.
In a similar vein, one fan added, “Everybody NEEDS this.”
“No acting goin on there..that’s true love,” another Instagram user wrote.
“They are absolute goals,” a comment read. “I love their love and support of each other.”
Brody and Meester have been together for more than a decade, but have remained relatively private about their relationship.
The couple are parents to two children, including daughter Arlo, who was born in August 2015, and a son who was born in 2020, though the couple have not yet shared his name publicly.
During a September 2024 appearance on “Today With Hoda & Jenna,” Brody gave rare comments about his marriage after he was asked by Hoda Kotb about the “magic” of his relationship with Meester.
“Pick someone good. Be lucky and be in love with someone who is great and then just listen to them,” he explained. “If you’re with someone great, you’re on third base.”

The actor added, “Not that it doesn’t take sacrifice and humility. And you have to grow together, and you have to be willing to grow, because you’re not going to be able to stay 100% right where you are.”

title: From the Super Bowl to ‘So High School’: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's relationship timeline
summary: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have been dating since September 2023. Here's a timeline of their relationship, and how it started with a friendship bracelet.
story: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce’s love story has been set in stadiums across the world, on the biggest stages in music and sports. Their romance fittingly started with a friendship bracelet — the symbol of the singer’s record-breaking “Eras Tour” — and now, a year and a half later, their relationship is one for the ages.

The timeline began when Kelce, a tight end for the Kansas City Chiefs, saw Swift perform at his home stadium in Kansas City, Missouri, in July 2023. After the concert, Kelce famously expressed his interest in Swift during an episode of “New Heights,” the podcast he hosts with his brother, former NFL star Jason Kelce. The tight end revealed that he had tried — and failed — to give Swift a bracelet with his phone number on it.

What fans didn’t know at the time was that Swift was paying attention, and the pair got to know each other behind the scenes. Rumors went into overdrive in September 2023 when Swift attended the first of many Chiefs games to cheer on Travis Kelce and his team.

Throughout the rest of the 2023-2024 NFL season, Swift became a fixture in stadium suites and on TV screens, attending more than a dozen Chiefs games and flying across nine times zones from an “Eras Tour” stop in Tokyo to watch the Chiefs win the 2024 Super Bowl.
In the 2024-2025 season, she attended nine games at Arrowhead Stadium, cheering on the Chiefs at home as they again made it all the way to the Super Bowl.
Meanwhile, Travis Kelce has traveled internationally to see Swift perform at “Eras Tour” concerts in Argentina, Singapore, Australia, France and even made an appearance onstage in London.
How did they get here? Here’s a detailed timeline of their relationship.
July 8, 2023: Travis Kelce attends 'Eras Tour' stop in Kansas City

Travis Kelce attended one of Swift’s “Eras Tour” concerts like millions of fans in the summer of 2023. But while Swifties were looking forward to hearing some of the musician’s biggest hits, Travis Kelce arrived with a plan to get Swift’s attention.
The tight end told his brother on the July 26, 2023, episode “New Heights” that he created a friendship bracelet with his phone number on it and intended to give it to Swift at the concert.

“I was disappointed that she doesn’t talk before or after her shows because she has to save her voice for the 44 songs that she sings. So I was a little butt-hurt I didn’t get to hand her one of the bracelets I made for her,” he said.
Aug. 2, 2023: Travis Kelce is asked about Taylor Swift by a reporter
NFL Network reporter Andrew Siciliano asked Travis Kabout his interest in Swift in an Aug. 2, 2023, interview.
As soon as Siciliano mentioned the “Anti-Hero” singer’s name in the video, Travis Kelce started laughing. The journalist then started to ask about his previous attempt to get Swift’s attention.
“I said what I said,” Travis Kelce responded. “And I meant what I said when I said it.”

He continued, “You know, what? It is what it is. I’m not going to talk about my personal life. I know what you writers want to hear. And you want to hear more about that, and I’m not going to give you anything.”
Siciliano pressed on, wondering if Swift reached out to Travis Kelce.
“And that’s going to wrap it up here at NFL training camp,” Travis Kelce playfully said, skirting the question, before the clip ended.
Sept. 21, 2023: Travis Kelce addresses the dating rumors

In a Sept. 21, 2023, visit to “The Pat McAfee Show,” Travis Kelce responded to comments his brother Jason made to sportscaster and former NFL star Tony Gonzalez the week before about him and Swift dating.
“The guy is absolutely ridiculous, can’t stay out of the freaking headlines,” the Chiefs tight end joked. “Please everybody, stop asking my brother about my love life.”
Travis Kelce also addressed the dating rumors head-on.

“I threw the ball in her court. I told her, I’ve seen you rock a stage in Arrowhead and you might have to come see me rock the stage at Arrowhead,” he said of his attempt to meet Swift at her concert in Kansas City. “We’ll see what happens in the near future.”
Sept. 24, 2023: Taylor Swift attends her first Chiefs game
Swift made headlines when she showed up to her first Kansas City Chiefs game to see the team take on the Chicago Bears at Arrowhead Stadium on Sept. 24, 2023.
The “Lover” singer was seen on TV enthusiastically cheering for Travis Kelce while seated next to his mom, Donna Kelce.

The Fox broadcast captured Swift throwing her hands in the air and celebrating when Travis Kelce scored a touchdown in the third quarter. The Grammy winner appeared to shout, “Let’s f------ go!” before excitedly banging her hands on the glass in the player’s box.
During the game, Fox announcers repeatedly chimed in about the possible romance between Swift and Travis Kelce in between plays.
“I mean, I think the secret’s out,” one NFL commentator said.
Sept. 27, 2023: Travis Kelce says his personal life will stay out of the spotlight
On the Sept. 27, 2023, episode of “New Heights,” Travis Kelce reacted to the mania around Swift’s surprise attendance at the Chiefs game days before.

“I just thought it was awesome how everybody in the suite had nothing but great things to say about her. You know, the friends and family. She looked amazing,” he said. “Everybody was talking about her in a great light and on top of that, the day went perfect for Chiefs fans, of course.”
He said the experience would be “a game I’ll remember.”
“And then we just slid off in the getaway car at the end,” he added, using a Swift song title to reference the viral photos of them leaving Arrowhead Stadium together in a convertible.
But the athlete said also said he plans to keep his personal life private.

“What’s real is that it’s my personal life and I want to respect both of our lives,” he said. “So everything moving forward, I think me talking about sports and saying, ‘All right now,’ would have to be kind of where I keep it.”
Oct. 1, 2023: Taylor Swift attends Chiefs-Jets game in New Jersey
Swift attended another Chiefs game on Oct. 1, 2023, when the Chiefs beat the New York Jets at MetLife Stadium in New Jersey.
Swift was spotted at the game with an entourage of famous friends, including Ryan Reynolds, Blake Lively, Sophie Turner, Hugh Jackman and more.
The night before the game, the singer was spotted grabbing dinner with her girlfriends and Brittany Mahomes, who’s married to Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes.
Oct. 6, 2023: Travis Kelce says he’s ‘even more on top of the world’ amid Taylor Swift relationship buzz
During a press conference Oct. 6, 2023, Travis Kelce addressed what it was like adjusting to a new level of fame because of the rumors about him and Swift.
“As all the attention comes, it feels like I was on top of the world after the Super Bowl and right now, even more on top of the world,” the athlete told reporters.
Travis Kelce added that he was “rolling with” the constant attention from paparazzi while attempting to separate work and play.

“You got a lot of people that care about Taylor for good reason," he said. "You just got to keep living and learning and enjoying the moments. At the end of the day, I’ve always been pretty good at compartmentalizing and being able to stay focused in this building.”
During a visit to TODAY the same day, Donna Kelce discussed how life had changed for her since she was spotted with Swift at a Chiefs game.
“It truly feels like I’m in some kind of an alternate universe,” she said. “It’s just really, really strange, but it’s fun. It’s a great ride.”
Oct. 12, 2023: Taylor Swift attends Chiefs-Broncos game

Just one day after appearing on the red carpet for the premiere of her “Eras Tour” concert film in Los Angeles, Swift was spotted in the player’s box at Arrowhead Stadium again as the Chiefs took on the Denver Broncos. She cheered on Travis Kelce’s team alongside both of his parents and Brittany Mahomes.
Oct. 14 + 15, 2023: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce make 'SNL' cameos and are seen out in NYC
Though they still hadn’t confirmed their romance to the media, Swift and Travis Kelce both made surprise cameos on the Oct. 14, 2023, episode of “Saturday Night Live.”

Travis Kelce popped up at the end of a sketch to poke fun at the NFL’s coverage of his then-rumored relationship. Swift briefly appeared on camera to introduce the episode’s musical guest, Ice Spice, with whom she collaborated on a remix of “Karma.”
After the episode aired, Swift and Travis Kelce were photographed walking hand-in-hand when arriving at Nobu in midtown Manhattan, and again when they left the restaurant.
The following night on Oct. 15, the singer and football star were photographed holding hands outside of Waverly Inn in New York City.
Oct. 22, 2023: Taylor Swift attends her fourth Chiefs game

Swift attended the Chargers-Chiefs game on Oct. 22, 2023, marking her fourth appearance at a Chiefs game in the 2023 season. She wore a red Chiefs sweatshirt and a gold friendship bracelet with Travis Kelce’s jersey number, 87.

Chariah Gordon, the now-fiancée of Travis Kelce’s teammate Mecole Hardman, Jr., shared pics taken at the game. One of them showed Swift giving Travis Kelce a sweet peck on the cheek while holding his shoulder, marking the first time the couple had been photographed sharing a kiss.
Nov. 10, 2023: Travis Kelce travels to see Swift in concert in Argentina — where she changes the lyrics to 'Karma' in his honor
As Swift kicked off the South American leg of her “Eras Tour,” Travis Kelce traveled to see her perform at a concert in Buenos Aires, Argentina, on Nov. 10, 2023.
During the show, Swift changed the lyrics to one of her biggest hits in honor of her beau.
“Karma is the guy on the Chiefs, coming straight home to me,” she sang, swapping the word “Chiefs” for “screen,” a lyric believed to be in reference to her ex, actor Joe Alwyn.
After the show ended, multiple fans captured videos of Swift running into Travis Kelce’s arms backstage and sharing a kiss.
Nov. 20, 2023: Travis Kelce acknowledges he and Swift are a couple and says he's 'never dated' anyone like her before
In an interview with WSJ. Magazine published Nov. 20, 2023, Travis Kelce reminisced about his attempt to meet Swift at her Arrowhead concert in July.
The NFL star alluded to the people who were “playing Cupid” for the two of them, although he didn’t specify who.
“There were definitely people she knew that knew who I was in her corner (who said): Yo! Did you know he was coming? I had somebody playing Cupid,” he told the publication.
Travis Kelce also recalled the couple’s first date, which he said took place in New York, although he declined to share details.
“When I met her in New York, we had already kind of been talking, so I knew we could have a nice dinner and, like, a conversation, and what goes from there will go from there,” he said.

Travis Kelce recalled that he managed to keep his nerves at bay, but his friends and family — not so much. “Everybody around me telling me: Don’t f--- this up! And me sitting here saying: Yeah — got it.”
During the same interview, Travis Kelce marveled over how Swift managed to enjoy her life despite the “scrutiny” she regularly faced.

"The scrutiny she gets, how much she has a magnifying glass on her, every single day, paparazzi outside her house, outside every restaurant she goes to, after every flight she gets off, and she’s just living, enjoying life," he said. "When she acts like that, I better not be the one acting all strange.”
Dec. 6, 2023: Taylor Swift speaks publicly about the couple's relationship for the first time
Swift broke her silence about her relationship with Travis Kelce when she was named Time’s Person of the Year for 2023.
In a story published in the magazine on Dec. 6, 2023, Swift revealed that she and Travis Kelce started dating after he “adorably put me on blast” on the “New Heights” podcast.
“We started hanging out right after that,” she said. “So we actually had a significant amount of time that no one knew, which I’m grateful for, because we got to get to know each other.
“By the time I went to that first game, we were a couple,” she added.
Swift was careful to emphasize that when she attended her first Chiefs game on Sept. 24, it was not the couple’s first date.
“We would never be psychotic enough to hard-launch a first date,” she said.

Swift went on to say that she and Travis Kelce enjoyed supporting each other at their respective public events — a stark contrast from her relationship with her ex Joe Alwyn, which took place largely out of the spotlight.

“When you say a relationship is public, that means I’m going to see him do what he loves, we’re showing up for each other, other people are there and we don’t care,” said Swift. “The opposite of that is you have to go to an extreme amount of effort to make sure no one knows that you’re seeing someone. And we’re just proud of each other.”
Dec. 3-31, 2023: Taylor Swift attends five consecutive Chiefs games
After Swift wrapped her “Eras Tour” for 2023, she became a regular guest at Travis Kelce’s games each week.
Starting on Dec. 3, 2023, with the Chiefs-Packers matchup in Wisconsin, Swift became a fixture. She went on to attend both home and away games against the Buffalo Bills and the New England Patriots.
On Christmas Day, she brought her whole family — including her brother, Austin, who dressed as Santa Claus — to the Chiefs-Raiders game.
Then on New Year's Eve, Swift cheered the Chiefs to victory against the Cincinnati Bengals.
But after the game, it was Travis Kelce who was doing the praising. In a video showcasing Swift’s outfit, Travis Kelce couldn’t help but add to the comment section.

Swift wore a white Jeff Hamilton Chiefs jacket, almost identical to one Travis Kelce wore before the Christmas Day game against the Las Vegas Raiders. In Hamilton’s post about the jacket, Travis Kelce commented fire and raised hands emoji.
Jan. 13-Jan. 28, 2024: Taylor Swift cheers on the Chiefs during the postseason — and shares a kiss with Travis Kelce on the field
Swift continued cheering on her boyfriend as the Chiefs went into the postseason in 2024.
When the Chiefs played the Miami Dolphins on Jan. 13, 2024, Swift sat with Donna Kelce again and repped a custom red puffer jacket featuring her boyfriend’s number, 87.

The jacket was designed by Kristin Juszczyk, the wife of 49ers player Kyle Juszczyk. Swift’s new pal Brittany Mahomes wore a matching jacket featuring the number 15, her husband Patrick Mahomes’ number.
Swift then traveled to Buffalo, New York, for the divisional round of the NFL playoffs and watched the Chiefs take on the Bills, winning 27-24.
She posed for pictures with her boyfriend’s brother and sister-in-law, Jason and Kylie Kelce, at the game.
Continuing her postseason streak, Swift attended the Chiefs' AFC championship game against the Baltimore Ravens on Jan. 28 with friends Keleigh Teller and Cara Delevingne.
After the Chiefs won 17-10 — positioning the team to take on the San Francisco 49ers in the 2024 Super Bowl —  Swift took to the field with Travis Kelce’s family and shared a kiss with her boyfriend.
Feb. 11, 2024: Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift celebrate the Chiefs winning Super Bowl 58
The Kansas City Chiefs edged the San Francisco 49ers, 25-22, in overtime to win Super Bowl 58, the team’s third championship in the last five seasons.
Swift flew across multiple time zones from her “Eras Tour” stop in Tokyo, Japan, to Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas to watch her boyfriend play.
Swift attended the game with Blake Lively and Ice Spice.
After the Chief’s victory, a huge celebration filled the field. Swift and Donna Kelce held each other close as they listened to Travis Kelce and others make speeches.
When Swift and Travis Kelce were finally reunited on the field, they embraced and kissed each other.
Feb. 23-March 8, 2024: Travis Kelce travels to Taylor Swift's international 'Eras Tour' shows
Just weeks after Swift cheered Travis Kelce to victory at the 2024 Super Bowl, he flew to Sydney, Australia, to see her perform in the first of several “Eras Tour” dates.
Based on videos shared by concertgoers, the Super Bowl champ clapped for his girlfriend on Feb. 23 and high-fived fans during the show.

Swift, meanwhile, gave her boyfriend a few shoutouts during the show. She included her signature lyric swap about him — singing “Karma is the guy on the Chiefs” during the finale — and also appeared to reference his Super Bowl win by pointing into the crowd while singing, “When they gave us our trophies...”
On March 8 and 9, Travis Kelce also attended his girlfriend's concerts in Singapore.
April 13, 2024: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce attend Coachella
When Swift and Travis Kelce attended Coachella together, the pop star wore a green baseball cap with the “New Heights” logo, a reference to the Kelce brothers’ podcast that started it all.

Fans shared adorable videos of Swift and Travis Kelce dancing along to performances from the band Bleachers, led by Swift’s longtime friend and collaborator Jack Antonoff, and Ice Spice, who performed her verses from Swift’s “Karma.”
April 19, 2024: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce share candid footage of one another in personal videos
Celebrating the release of her 11th album, “The Tortured Poets Department,” Swift released a YouTube Short video filled with clips from a two-week period in her life.
The video included an appearance from Travis Kelce, who is seen swooping in to give Swift a kiss on her cheek.

Other clips showed Swift wearing a University of Kansas shirt, frosting cinnamon rolls, playing pickleball and hanging out on a yacht with friends. She’s also seen visiting Singapore’s Gardens by the Bay with Travis Kelce.
April 19, 2024: Taylor Swift releases 'TTPD,' including new songs that fans believe are about Travis Kelce

While most of “The Tortured Poets Department” chronicles Taylor Swift’s “saddest story” and a “period of the author’s life now over,” many fans suspected that Travis Kelce is referenced in some of the album’s happier lyrics.
In “The Alchemy,” Swift sings about giving in to an almost-magical relationship through a chorus overflowing with football metaphors.

Then in “So High School,” she sings about a pure, youthful love and mentions a game of “marry, kiss, kill,” seemingly referencing a 2016 interview with the tight end tied to his short-lived dating show, “Catching Kelce.”

Swift also showed up in a welcome video for her boyfriend's annual music festival, Kelce Jam, on May 18. The montage included a clip of Swift clapping on the field after the Chiefs defeated the 49ers in the 2024 Super Bowl.
At the event, Travis Kelce opened up about his favorite music off Swift's new album when he spoke to “Access Hollywood."

“‘So High School’ might be the only one jumping into my mind right now. I think everybody will get fired up for that one,” he said. “‘The Man’ is my niece’s favorite, so we can always go with ‘The Man.’”
April 27, 2024: Taylor Swift attends charity gala with Travis Kelce in Las Vegas
Swift and Travis Kelce showed their support for Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes when they attended the 15 and the Mahomies Vegas Golf Classic gala in Las Vegas on April 27.

In a video shared on X, Swift and Travis Kelce are seen walking hand and hand through the venue. Swift wore a metallic green gown while the tight end opted for a blue suit with a white shirt, sans tie.
In a video shared by an attendee to Instagram, Travis Kelce took the stage alongside the night’s auctioneer to offer attendees a surprise item up for bid.

“I was just talking to my significant other, and we might have one other auction item that wasn’t on the docket. Has anybody heard of the ‘Eras Tour?’” Travis Kelce said to the crowd as he helped auction off four tickets to one of Swift’s show’s.
June 23, 2024: Travis Kelce makes surprise onstage appearance at 'Eras Tour' in London
Travis Kelce made a surprise cameo onstage during one of Taylor Swift’s “Eras Tour” concerts at Wembley Stadium in London.
During the June 23 show, Travis Kelce, dressed in a black suit and top hat, popped up onstage alongside Swift and several dancers during her performance of “I Can Do It With a Broken Heart.”
The football pro joined the dancers to perform a pantomime routine that showed them trying to get Swift ready for the rest of her show.
The crowd cheered as Travis Kelce picked up Swift at one point and carried her around the stage.
During the "Eras Tour" stop in London, Swift and Travis Kelce also notably met and posed for a selfie with Prince William and his kids Prince George and Princess Charlotte.
Sept. 5, 2024: Taylor Swift attends first Chiefs game of the 2024 season
Swift helped the Chiefs kick off the 2024 season on Sept. 5 when she showed up at Arrowhead Stadium to watch the team claim victory over the Baltimore Ravens.
The singer was back at Arrowhead again on Sept. 15 to cheer on the Chiefs as they beat the Cincinnati Bengals in their second game of the season.
Swift, who was dressed in an oversized Chiefs T-shirt and thigh-high black boots, attended the Chiefs-Bengals game with her mom, Andrea Swift, and Haim singer and guitarist Danielle Haim.
The three women joined up with Ed and Donna Kelce to watch the game in a stadium suite.
Sept. 8, 2024: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce attend the U.S. Open and more in New York
Swift and Travis Kelce attended the the U.S. Open tennis championship at Arthur Ashe Stadium in New York City on Sept. 8, 2024.
The couple looked fashionable as they watched Jannik Sinner of Italy beat Taylor Fritz, the first American player to make it to the final since 2006.

Swift wore a red gingham dress and shades while Travis Kelce wore a white shirt, cardigan sweater and red and green striped Gucci hat — nearly twinning with Brittany Mahomes, who joined the couple with her husband Patrick Mahomes for a double date.
Sept. 11, 2024: Taylor Swift thanks Travis Kelce in VMAs acceptance speech
When Swift took home the award for video of the year at the 2024 MTV Video Music Awards, she used her speech to thank her team, fans and one person very special to her: Travis Kelce.
The pop star won the final award of the evening for her song “Fortnight,” featuring Post Malone.

“Something that I’ll always remember is that when I would finish a take... I would always just hear someone like, cheering from across the studio where we were shooting it,” she said while recalling the experience of filming the music video.
“And that one person was my boyfriend, Travis.”
“Everything this man touches turns to happiness and fun and magic,” she continued. “So I want to thank him for adding that to our shoot, because I’ll always remember that.”
December 2024: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce inspire Christmas movies
Swift and Travis Kelce's relationship sounds so fairytale-like, it has inspired not one, but two romance films for the 2024 holiday season.

Their relationship provided some of the "magic" that inspired the Chiefs-centric Hallmark film, "Holiday Touchdown," which premiered on the network Nov. 30. The film follows a Chiefs super fan and the team's director of fan engagement and marks Donna Kelce's film debut.

Meanwhile, Lifetime told a more pulled-from-the-headlines story with "Christmas in the Spotlight," which follows a pop star and football player falling in love, featuring a script full of references to Swift.
Jan. 26, 2025: Taylor Swift celebrates on the field with Travis Kelce after AFC championship
The Chiefs emerged victorious from the AFC championship for the fifth time in six years after beating the Buffalo Bills 32-29. Swift attended the game with her whole family.
After the win, Swift joined Kelce on the field, where they were photographed sharing a hug.
The official X account for the NFL also shared footage of the couple talking on the field after.
“This is so insane,” Swift said. “This is not a real-life situation.”
“It wasn’t like this in Baltimore last year,” Kelce added.
Feb. 2, 2025: Fans suspect Taylor Swift's Grammys outfit has a nod to Travis Kelce
Swift’s outfit for the 2025 Grammys may have contained a special reference to Travis Kelce.

The football star was unable to attend the award show due to Super Bowl preparation (he also missed the Grammys in 2024, when Swift when album of the year for “Midnights”), but Swift’s red mini-dress at the event had some thinking of the Chiefs.

Plus, the chain draping over her thigh featured a dangling “T” charm. While the “T” could represent a monogram for “Taylor,” many fans thought it referenced a lyric from “The Tortured Poets Department.”
“that T chain is so ‘What if he’s written ‘mine’ on my upper thigh’ coded,” one person tweeted, referring to lyrics from the song “Guilty As Sin?”
If the “T” detail was a reference to the song, the initial likely stands for her boyfriend — Travis.
Feb. 6, 2025:  Travis Kelce's dad says Travis and  Taylor will be 'connecting more' after Super Bowl
A few days before the 2025 Super Bowl, Travis Kelce's father, Ed, did an interview with Today Australia where he shared his thoughts on how the couple will use their free time after the Super Bowl.

“I think, you know, we get past the Super Bowl it’s going to be a very good period of time for the two of them,” he said. “Without the NFL season without the Eras Tour. Just them alone really connecting more and I think that can only be a good thing."

title: Ralph Fiennes explains why his name isn't pronounced the way you think it is
summary: Oscar-nominated "Conclave" actor Ralph Fiennes explained why his name is pronounced the way it's pronounced.
story: He Who Must Not Be Named actually has a name — and it's often pronounced incorrectly.
Ralph Fiennes, known for his role as Lord Voldemort in the "Harry Potter" series, set the record straight on how to pronounce his own name at the Santa Barbara International Film Festival.
"From R-a-l-p-h F-i-e-n-n-e-s, (how) could we get Ralph Fiennes?" an interviewer asked the British actor onstage at the festival, according to a TikTok posted by The Hollywood Reporter on Feb. 7.
Fiennes, 62, broke out into a huge grin before giving an explanation of why his first name is pronounced "Rayfe."

"Well, it's one of those funky, old English things that I was dealt — my parents dealt me this hand, this name," he said. "I think it's the case that the spelling R-a-l-p-h used to be pronounced — and I have met other 'Rayfes' spelt 'Ralph.' That was the old way to pronounce 'Ralph.' You said, 'Rayfe.'"
"I've always had to deal with this question," he continued, leading the crowd to burst into laughter.
And he's not exaggerating — multiple articles from 2011 attempted to answer this question, including The New Yorker's "How Do You Say Ralph Fiennes?"
In an interview with The Hollywood Reporter in 2011, Fiennes said he sometimes wished he had fixed the public's pronunciation of his name sooner, but that he felt it was "too late."
"That was the name I was born with and I sort of have some weird thing about, I’m sticking with what I was given," he said.
Fiennes also shared the story behind his name in the 2011 interview.
"I believe my father named me after his stepgrandfather. His name was Ralph Eastwood, nicknamed Rusty, but spelt R-a-l-p-h," he said.
“And I wanted to, I suppose, honor my parents giving me this name and keeping up the spelling but I have — I’ve come on occasion to regret it because it would be easier,” he continued.

The presenters of the 2025 Academy Awards should start preparing to say his name out loud: Fiennes is nominated for the best actor award for his role in "Conclave," a political thriller about the selection of a new pope.
This year's Oscars ceremony is scheduled to be held on March 2, and Fiennes is up against Adrien Brody, Timothée Chalamet, Colman Domingo and Sebastian Stan.

title: How to watch and stream the Critics Choice Awards for free
summary: Read on for everything to know about the 2025 Critics Choice Awards and how to watch and stream them for free.
story: The 2025 Critics Choice Awards were a star-studded awards show.
The show, held Feb. 7, was previously postponed from Sunday, Jan. 12 to Sunday, Jan. 26, following the destructive and fatal fires that happened across Los Angeles last month.

The Critics Choice Association (CCA) is honoring the best in film and television. In attendance were “Wicked” stars Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo, as well as Colman Domingo, Angelina Jolie and the casts of “Nobody Wants This” and “Shōgun,” among others.
Read on for everything to know about the 2025 Critics Choice Awards and how to watch and stream them for free.
When are the 2025 Critics Choice Awards?
The 2025 Critics Choice Awards were held on Friday, Feb. 7 from the Barker Hangar in Santa Monica, California.
What time are the 2025 Critics Choice Awards?
The 30th annual Critics Choice Awards began at 7 p.m. ET and ran until 10:00 p.m. ET.
How to watch the 2025 Critics Choice Awards
The 30th annual Critics Choice Awards were broadcast live on E!.
How to stream the 2025 Critics Choice Awards
For those looking to stream the show for free, streaming services FuboTV and DirecTV Stream both offer free trial periods and include E! in their channel offerings.
The show will also be available to stream the next day on Peacock.
Will there be a pre-show?
No, there wasn't a pre-show for the 2025 Critics Choice Awards.

Following the news that the show was rescheduled for February, the CCA announced that there would no longer be a “Live from E!: Critics Choice Awards” two-hour red carpet special ahead of the telecast.
Who is hosting the 2025 Critics Choice Awards?
Chelsea Handler hosted the 2025 Critics Choice Awards for a third year in a row.
Who is presenting at the 2025 Critics Choice Awards?

Among the presenters included Aldis Hodge, Allison Tolman, Chase Stokes, Craig Robinson, David Alan Grier, David Harbour, Ewan McGregor, Jackie Chan, Jesse Eisenberg, Jimmy O. Yang, Josh Groban, Justine Lupe and Kate Hudson.

Additionally, Kathryn Hahn, Keri Russell, Kristen Bell, Lupita Nyong’o, Mark-Paul Gosselaar, Matt Bomer, Melissa Rauch, Meredith Hagner, Michelle Yeoh, Natasha Lyonne and Orlando Bloom took the stage as presenters.
Rounding out the list of presenters were Rachel Brosnahan, Randall Park, Rufus Sewell, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Shanola Hampton and Wendi McLendon-Covey.
Who is nominated for a 2025 Critics Choice Award?
“Conclave” and “Wicked” lead this year’s film contenders with 11 nominations each 11, including best picture.
On the television side, “Shōgun” had the most nominations with six nods, winning best drama series.
